pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.

pokedex_data.local: 0066 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)0245 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0085 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: This ancient Pokémon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: This calm Pokémon lived in a cold land where there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It lived in cold areas in ancient times. It’s said that when Amaura whinnies, auroras appear in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Amaura was restored successfully, but it’s not expected to live long because of the heat of the current environment.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. In the past, it lived with others of its kind in cold lands where there were fewer predators.
pokedex_entries.shield: Amaura is an ancient Pokémon that has gone extinct. Specimens of this species can sometimes be found frozen in ice.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant, and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Its scent is so overpowering that, unless a Trainer happens to really enjoy the smell, he or she will have a hard time walking alongside it.
pokedex_entries.sword: The scent that constantly emits from its fur is so powerful that this Pokémon’s companions will eventually lose their sense of smell.
pokedex_entries.shield: The scents Aromatisse can produce range from sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells that sap an opponent’s will to fight.

pokedex_data.local: 0067 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)0246 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0086 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Using its diamond-shaped crystals, it can instantly create a wall of ice to block an opponent’s attack.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: An Aurorus was found frozen solid within a glacier, just as it appeared long ago, which became quite a big event in the news.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: This usually quiet and kindly Pokémon has a surface temperature of around –240 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.sword: Aurorus was restored from a fossil. It’s said that when this Pokémon howls, auroras appear in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.shield: When gripped by rage, Aurorus will emanate freezing air, covering everything around it in ice.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back makes it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.
pokedex_entries.sword: At high latitudes, this Pokémon can be found with clusters of Bergmite on its back as it swims among the icebergs.
pokedex_entries.shield: As Avalugg moves about during the day, the cracks in its body deepen. The Pokémon’s body returns to a pristine state overnight.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: As Avalugg walks along with Bergmite on its back, it comes across pods of Cetitan. It lets them pass to avoid conflict.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon uses its massive icy body to flatten anything that gets in its way. When it’s floating out on the ocean, it looks exactly like drift ice.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven. They fight with the power of seven Binacle.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Barbaracle’s legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head’s orders.
pokedex_entries.sword: Seven Binacle come together to form one Barbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head gives orders to those serving as the limbs.
pokedex_entries.shield: Having an eye on each palm allows it to keep watch in all directions. In a pinch, its limbs start to act on their own to ensure the enemy’s defeat.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It blocks opponents’ attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.
pokedex_entries.sword: They chill the air around them to −150 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing the water in the air into ice that they use as armor.
pokedex_entries.shield: This Pokémon lives in areas of frigid cold. It secures itself to the back of an Avalugg by freezing its feet in place.
pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: Lives on mountains blanketed in perennial snow. It freezes water vapor in the air to make the ice helmet that it dons for defense.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: They live in mountainous regions of frigid cold. On rare occasions, they ride on the back of an Avalugg to cross seas and move to new habitats.
pokedex_entries.violet: Bergmite protects itself by coating its body in ice formed by frigid air of −148 degrees Fahrenheit. It fights with Frigibax whenever they meet.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.
pokedex_entries.sword: After two Binacle find a suitably sized rock, they adhere themselves to it and live together. They cooperate to gather food during high tide.
pokedex_entries.shield: If the two don’t work well together, both their offense and defense fall apart. Without good teamwork, they won’t survive.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.
pokedex_entries.sword: It excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can dig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.
pokedex_entries.shield: It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknight’s flapping will have Bunnelby digging a hole to hide underground in moments.

pokedex_data.local: 0124 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)0101 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)0123 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0128 (The Crown Tundra)0167 (The Teal Mask)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It’s occasionally found during the excavation of caves.
pokedex_entries.sun: Born from the high temperatures and pressures deep underground, it defends itself by firing beams from the jewel part of its body.
pokedex_entries.moon: Although this Pokémon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Some say that deep beneath the surface of the world, a pack of Carbink live with their queen in a kingdom of jewels.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: To keep the jewels on their bodies free of tarnish, packs of Carbink use their soft manes to polish one another’s jewels.
pokedex_entries.sword: When beset by attackers, Carbink wipes them all out by firing high-energy beams from the gems embedded in its body.
pokedex_entries.shield: It’s said that somewhere in the world, there’s a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering Carbink. It’s also said that this pack has a queen.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.

pokedex_data.local: 0032 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)0349 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0339 (Scarlet/Violet)0196 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Through controlled explosions of internal gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot. At close distances, it can shatter rock.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Its claws occasionally fall off, and it keeps a low profile until they grow back. The meat of its claws is so delicious!
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It moves around by jetting water from its right pincer. It has a poor sense of balance, so it’s terrible at swimming straight.
pokedex_entries.sword: Clauncher’s claws can fall off during battle, but they’ll regenerate. The meat inside the claws is popular as a delicacy in Galar.
pokedex_entries.shield: By detonating gas that accumulates in its right claw, this Pokémon launches water like a bullet. This is how Clauncher defeats its enemies.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon launches water by detonating gas inside its right claw. It snipes flying Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.violet: Clauncher’s claws will regrow if they fall off. The meat inside the claws is edible, but it has a distinct flavor that doesn’t appeal to all tastes.

pokedex_data.local: 0033 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)0350 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0340 (Scarlet/Violet)0197 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It compresses the water it has sucked up and then projects it with enough power to punch a hole right through a thick sheet of iron.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its right arm is packed with meat. When its pincer falls off, it’s exported to be used as a cooking ingredient.
pokedex_entries.sword: After using the feelers on its oversized claw to detect the location of prey, Clawitzer launches a cannonball of water at its target.
pokedex_entries.shield: Clawitzer’s right arm is a cannon that launches projectiles made of seawater. Shots from a Clawitzer’s cannon arm can sink a tanker.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Clawitzer can move through the water at a speed of 60 knots by using gas inside its body to expel water from the back of its claw.
pokedex_entries.violet: The cannonballs of seawater that Clawitzer launches from its claw are powerful enough to punch through tanker hulls.

pokedex_data.local: 0110 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)0291 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0200 (Scarlet/Violet)0103 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It sneaks into people’s homes and steals electricity from their outlets. When your electric bill seems off, it’s the handiwork of this rascal.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its upper whiskers are sensors that survey its surroundings. Its lower whiskers are organs that shoot electricity.
pokedex_entries.sword: A Dedenne’s whiskers pick up electrical waves other Dedenne send out. These Pokémon share locations of food or electricity with one another.
pokedex_entries.shield: Since Dedenne can’t generate much electricity on its own, it steals electricity from outlets or other electric Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: It’s small and its electricity-generating organ is not fully developed, so it uses its tail to absorb electricity from people’s homes and charge itself.
pokedex_entries.violet: Dedenne emit electrical waves from the whiskers on their cheeks to communicate with each other. When low on electricity, they curl up and sleep.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. They can be a big help at construction sites.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When it’s finished digging, it lounges lazily.
pokedex_entries.sword: With power equal to an excavator, it can dig through dense bedrock. It’s a huge help during tunnel construction.
pokedex_entries.shield: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords, which cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks and slash their enemies to ribbons.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.
pokedex_entries.sword: Honedge evolves into twins. The two blades rub together to emit a metallic sound that unnerves opponents.
pokedex_entries.shield: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.

pokedex_data.local: 0031 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)0348 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0338 (Scarlet/Violet)0195 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: This vicious Pokémon sprays a poisonous liquid on opponents that come near. For whatever reason, it gets along really well with Dhelmise.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It blends in with seaweed to ambush its prey and then takes them down with a poisonous liquid strong enough to melt metal.
pokedex_entries.sword: Dragalge uses a poisonous liquid capable of corroding metal to send tankers that enter its territory to the bottom of the sea.
pokedex_entries.shield: Dragalge generates dragon energy by sticking the plume on its head out above the ocean’s surface and bathing it in sunlight.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Using a liquid poison, Dragalge indiscriminately attacks anything that wanders into its territory. This poison can corrode the undersides of boats.
pokedex_entries.violet: Since Finizen is the better swimmer, Dragalge will approach it under the cover of seaweed, then immobilize it with a poisonous attack.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It has enough psychic energy to blast everything within 300 feet of itself, but it has no control over its power.
pokedex_entries.sword: Though Espurr’s expression never changes, behind that blank stare is an intense struggle to contain its devastating psychic power.
pokedex_entries.shield: There’s enough psychic power in Espurr to send a wrestler flying, but because this power can’t be controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the wind’s embrace with an untroubled heart.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It’s not safe without the power of a flower, but it will keep traveling around until it finds one with the color and shape it wants.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.

pokedex_data.local: 0015 (X/Y — Central Kalos)0159 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)0193 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0020 (Scarlet/Violet)0023 (The Isle of Armor)0088 (The Indigo Disk)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: The hotter the flame sac on its belly, the faster it can fly, but it takes some time to get the fire going.
pokedex_entries.sun: From its beak, it fires embers at its prey. Once it has caught them, it grills them at high heat before feasting upon them.
pokedex_entries.moon: It will not tolerate other Fletchinder entering its territory, which has a radius of several miles.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It scatters embers in the tall grass. Then bug Pokémon, frightened by the flames, come flying out, and Fletchinder gobbles them up.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its speed right after takeoff already puts it in the top speed class of all bird Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.sword: Fletchinder launches embers into the den of its prey. When the prey comes leaping out, Fletchinder’s sharp talons finish it off.
pokedex_entries.shield: Fletchinder are exceedingly territorial and aggressive. These Pokémon fight among themselves over feeding grounds.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Fletchinder scatters embers in tall grass where bug Pokémon might be hiding and then catches them as they come leaping out.
pokedex_entries.violet: Its territory has a radius of just over a mile. If any bird Pokémon should enter, it will show them no mercy.

pokedex_data.local: 0014 (X/Y — Central Kalos)0158 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)0192 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0019 (Scarlet/Violet)0022 (The Isle of Armor)0087 (The Indigo Disk)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: These friendly Pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Despite the beauty of its lilting voice, it’s merciless to intruders that enter its territory.
pokedex_entries.sun: This amiable Pokémon is easy to train. But when battle is joined, it shows its ferocious side.
pokedex_entries.moon: When it’s excited, its temperature can double, spiking hormone production in its body.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: While it’s an amiable Pokémon, if you touch it unexpectedly, it will heat up its body in an instant, and you’ll be burned.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its body is always warm. Trainers who live in cold areas apparently sleep with it in their bed.
pokedex_entries.sword: Its melodious cries are actually warnings. Fletchling will mercilessly peck at anything that enters its territory.
pokedex_entries.shield: When this Pokémon gets excited, its body temperature increases sharply. If you touch a Fletchling with bare hands, you might get burned.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon is normally calm, but once it enters battle, its hormonal balance changes and it becomes aggressive.
pokedex_entries.violet: Fletchling can be found in both rural and urban areas. They once had a huge territorial dispute with Squawkabilly. Fights broke out all over town.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It raises flowers and uses them as weapons. The more gorgeous the blossom, the more power it contains.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: In times long past, governors of castles would invite Florges to create flower gardens to embellish the castle domains.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It controls the flowers it grows. The petal blizzards that Florges triggers are overwhelming in their beauty and power.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Historically, in the Kalos region, these Pokémon were the designated guardians of the king.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou’s fur into the most exquisite style.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It can tell how its Trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathic sense lets them run as if one being.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: It can sense the feelings of others by touching them with its horns. This species has assisted people with their work since 5,000 years ago.
pokedex_entries.violet: These Pokémon live in herds in mountainous places. The victor in their contests of clashing horns will become the leader of the herd.

pokedex_data.local: 0021 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)0180 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)0219 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0391 (Sword/Shield)0117 (Legends: Arceus)0174 (Scarlet/Violet)0062 (The Isle of Armor)0180 (The Teal Mask)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It attacks with retractable horns. It throws a punch that’s the equivalent of the force of a hundred pro boxers.
pokedex_entries.sun: An amazingly friendly Pokémon, but if left to itself, loneliness overcomes it, and it oozes gooey tears.
pokedex_entries.moon: It gets picked on because it’s meek. But then, whoever teased it gets to feel the full force of its horns and a good swatting from its thick tail.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It’s very friendly toward people. If you grow close to it, Goodra will hug you with its sticky, slime-covered body. Don’t get mad.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Underneath its slimy skin is a thick layer of fat, and the combination of the two makes enemies’ attacks slide right off.
pokedex_entries.sword: Sometimes it misunderstands instructions and appears dazed or bewildered. Many Trainers don’t mind, finding this behavior to be adorable.
pokedex_entries.shield: Its form of offense is forcefully stretching out its horns. The strikes land 100 times harder than any blow from a heavyweight boxer.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: It loves the rain. This mellow Pokémon can be seen walking around on the plains and in the mountains on rainy days.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon is uncontrollable when enraged. It rampages on and on, lashing its tail with enough power to send a dump truck flying.

pokedex_data.local: 0019 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)0178 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)0217 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0389 (Sword/Shield)0115 (Legends: Arceus)0172 (Scarlet/Violet)0060 (The Isle of Armor)0178 (The Teal Mask)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn’t dry out.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It’s covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.
pokedex_entries.sun: The weakest of all Dragon-type Pokémon, it’s unable to breathe if its skin dries out, so it sticks to shady places.
pokedex_entries.moon: Its source of protection is its slimy, germ-laden mucous membrane. Anyone who touches it needs some thorough hand-washing.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It uses its horns to check out its surroundings. They’re very sensitive, so if you grab them, it will feel a strong shock and be unable to move.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its body is mostly water. If it dries out, it will die, so it’s always sitting with perfect stillness in the shade.
pokedex_entries.sword: Because most of its body is water, it will dry up if the weather becomes too arid. It’s considered the weakest dragon Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.shield: Their horns are powerful sensors. As soon as Goomy pick up any sign of enemies, they go into hiding. This is how they’ve survived.
pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: Goomy hides away in the shade of trees, where it’s nice and humid. If the slime coating its body dries out, the Pokémon instantly becomes lethargic.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Most of a Goomy’s body is water. A membrane covers the whole Pokémon to prevent it from shriveling up in dry weather.
pokedex_entries.violet: Goomy’s horns are excellent sensory organs that cover all five of Goomy’s senses. Goomy picks up on danger from the movement of the air.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It overwhelms opponents with quick moves, but sometimes it showboats for too long when it’s using a special move and gets itself into a pinch.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: In combat, Hawlucha leaps nimbly about, taking advantage of its opponents’ blind spots. It’s also skilled at using superb submission holds.
pokedex_entries.sword: It drives its opponents to exhaustion with its agile maneuvers, then ends the fight with a flashy finishing move.
pokedex_entries.shield: It always strikes a pose before going for its finishing move. Sometimes opponents take advantage of that time to counterattack.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Its elegant finishing moves—performed by nimbly leaping around using its wings—are polished in the forest where it was born and raised.
pokedex_entries.violet: Hawlucha live quietly without flocking together. They fight constantly with their natural enemies: noisy groups of Primeape.

pokedex_data.abilities: 1. Dry Skin2. Sand VeilSolar Power (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.
pokedex_entries.sword: A now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.
pokedex_entries.shield: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.

pokedex_data.abilities: 1. Dry Skin2. Sand VeilSolar Power (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.
pokedex_entries.sword: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon’s electric moves.
pokedex_entries.shield: The sun powers this Pokémon’s electricity generation. Interruption of that process stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person’s arm and drains that person’s life energy completely.
pokedex_entries.sword: Honedge’s soul once belonged to a person who was killed a long time ago by the sword that makes up Honedge’s body.
pokedex_entries.shield: The blue eye on the sword’s handguard is the true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it drains people’s lives away.

pokedex_entries.x: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space.
pokedex_entries.y: It gathers things it likes and passes them through its loop to teleport them to a secret place.
pokedex_entries.omega_ruby: In its true form, it possess a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.
pokedex_entries.alpha_sapphire: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

pokedex_data.local: 0010 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)0026 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0290 (Sword/Shield)0108 (The Isle of Armor)0080 (The Indigo Disk)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent’s will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It draws prey near with its blinking lights and then wraps them up in its long tentacles and holds them in place.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: When exchanging information with others of its kind, it flashes the light-emitting spots on its body in a complex rhythm.
pokedex_entries.sword: It spins while making its luminescent spots flash. These spots allow it to communicate with others by using different patterns of light.
pokedex_entries.shield: By exposing foes to the blinking of its luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them, and then it seizes the chance to flee.

pokedex_data.local: 0050 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)0241 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)0314 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0240 (Scarlet/Violet)0028 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.
pokedex_entries.sun: This even-tempered Pokémon has a habit of collecting keys. It will sneak into people’s homes to steal their keys.
pokedex_entries.moon: It inserts its horn into chinks in metal, absorbing metal ions. For some reason, it collects keys.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Although it’s unclear why it collects keys, giving it a key makes Klefki very happy. However, it apparently only likes master keys.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Long ago it lived in mines, but once the minerals that make up its diet became scarcer, Klefki began appearing in human settlements.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon is constantly collecting keys. Entrust a Klefki with important keys, and the Pokémon will protect them no matter what.
pokedex_entries.shield: Klefki sucks in metal ions with the horn topping its head. It seems this Pokémon loves keys so much that its head needed to look like one, too.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Once it absorbs a key’s metal ions, it discards the key without a second thought. However, it will hang on to keys it favors for decades.
pokedex_entries.violet: In the past, noble families entrusted their vault keys to a Klefki. They passed the Klefki down through the generations, taking good care of it.

pokedex_data.local: 0057 (X/Y — Central Kalos)0370 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0224 (Scarlet/Violet)0036 (The Indigo Disk)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: When they’re young, they live with a pride. Once they’re able to hunt prey on their own, they’re kicked out and have to make their own way.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: This hot-blooded Pokémon is filled with curiosity. When it gets angry or starts fighting, its short mane gets hot.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: When Litleo are young, female Pyroar will teach them how to hunt. Once the Litleo mature, they will leave the pride and set out on their own.
pokedex_entries.violet: The more a Litleo trains its body and spirit by battling mighty enemies, the hotter its mane will grow.

pokedex_data.local: 0011 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)0027 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0291 (Sword/Shield)0109 (The Isle of Armor)0081 (The Indigo Disk)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any Pokémon, and it forces others to do whatever it wants.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It lures its prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: When it comes to strong hypnosis, there’s an endless number of people who utilize Malamar for their nefarious deeds.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It flashes the pattern on its torso to control its prey and draw them in. The edges of its fins are supremely sharp.
pokedex_entries.sword: Gazing at its luminescent spots will quickly induce a hypnotic state, putting the observer under Malamar’s control.
pokedex_entries.shield: It’s said that Malamar’s hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.

pokedex_data.local: 0113 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)0083 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0176 (Sword/Shield)0303 (Scarlet/Violet)0181 (The Crown Tundra)0088 (The Teal Mask)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Fruits are its favorite foods. This gourmet carefully picks out just the ripe ones using its sonar.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It flies around in search of fruit to eat. It uses ultrasonic waves to detect which fruits are ripe.
pokedex_entries.sword: After nightfall, they emerge from the caves they nest in during the day. Using their ultrasonic waves, they go on the hunt for ripened fruit.
pokedex_entries.shield: No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibat’s ability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it generates can overcome much larger Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from its large ears to search for fruit to eat. It mistakes Applin for its food.
pokedex_entries.violet: Noibat can change the frequency of its sound waves at will, and it generates ultrasonic waves of up to 200,000 hertz.

pokedex_data.local: 0114 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)0084 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0177 (Sword/Shield)0304 (Scarlet/Violet)0182 (The Crown Tundra)0089 (The Teal Mask)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It swoops out of the dark to attack.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Although it has a violent disposition, if you give it a nice ripe fruit that it loves, Noivern will suddenly become tame.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: This hot-blooded Pokémon attacks anything it sees with ultrasonic waves that can crush boulders.
pokedex_entries.sword: Aggressive and cruel, this Pokémon will ruthlessly torment enemies that are helpless in the dark.
pokedex_entries.shield: Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies with ultrasonic waves that could crush stone. Its fangs finish the fight.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Ultrasonic waves emitted by a Noivern can pulverize a large boulder. This Pokémon has a cruel disposition.
pokedex_entries.violet: In the dark, even Hydreigon are terrified of this Pokémon. But in the light, Noivern is the one that avoids battle.

pokedex_data.local: 0091 (X/Y — Central Kalos)0220 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)0284 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0111 (Sword/Shield)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It does its best to be taken seriously by its enemies, but its glare is not sufficiently intimidating. Chewing on a leaf is its trademark.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It does its level best to glare and pull a scary face, but it can’t help grinning if anyone pats its head.
pokedex_entries.sun: It grows up imitating the behavior of Pangoro, which it looks up to as a leader.
pokedex_entries.moon: There’s no point to the leaf in its mouth, aside from an effort to look cool. It’s mischievous, so it’s not well suited to inexperienced Trainers.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It follows Pangoro around like a henchman. When Pancham makes a big mistake, its leaf gets taken away.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It’s desperate to intimidate its opponents. Be nice and pretend to be scared if you catch it glaring at you intensely.
pokedex_entries.sword: It chooses a Pangoro as its master and then imitates its master’s actions. This is how it learns to battle and hunt for prey.
pokedex_entries.shield: Wanting to make sure it’s taken seriously, Pancham’s always giving others a glare. But if it’s not focusing, it ends up smiling.

pokedex_data.local: 0092 (X/Y — Central Kalos)0221 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)0285 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0112 (Sword/Shield)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Although it possesses a violent temperament, it won’t put up with bullying. It uses the leaf in its mouth to sense the movements of its enemies.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It charges ahead and bashes its opponents like a berserker, uncaring about any hits it might take. Its arms are mighty enough to snap a telephone pole.
pokedex_entries.sun: It boasts superb physical strength. Those who wish to become Pangoro’s Trainer have no choice but to converse with their fists.
pokedex_entries.moon: From the slight twitches of its bamboo leaf, it deduces its opponent’s movements. It’s eager to tussle but kindhearted toward its companions.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: This rowdy Pokémon boasts great physical strength. Many Trainers are also smitten by its lively character.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Pangoro is the type to talk with its fists. It doesn’t say much as it pummels opponents with enough force to send a dump truck flying.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon is quick to anger, and it has no problem using its prodigious strength to get its way. It lives for duels against Obstagoon.
pokedex_entries.shield: Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of its opponents. It strikes with punches that can turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.

pokedex_data.local: 0061 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)0196 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)0250 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0338 (Sword/Shield)0033 (The Crown Tundra)0068 (The Teal Mask)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: These Pokémon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: According to old tales, these Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died while lost in the forest.
pokedex_entries.sun: These Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died in the forest. Their cries sound like eerie screams.
pokedex_entries.moon: According to legend, medicine to cure any illness can be made by plucking the green leaves on its head, brewing them, and boiling down the liquid.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: By imitating the voice of a child, it causes people to get hopelessly lost deep in the forest. It’s trying to make friends with them.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: An unknown spirit came to lodge in a tree stump, creating this Pokémon. A cure-all can be made from an infusion of its green leaves.
pokedex_entries.sword: After a lost child perished in the forest, their spirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit’s rebirth as this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.shield: With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.

pokedex_data.local: 0058 (X/Y — Central Kalos)0371 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0225 (Scarlet/Violet)0037 (The Indigo Disk)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the pride’s cubs.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: The males are usually lazy, but when attacked by a strong foe, a male will protect its friends with no regard for its own safety.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: The temperature of its breath is over 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, but Pyroar doesn’t use it on its prey. This Pokémon prefers to eat raw meat.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: The females of a pride work together to bring down prey. It’s thanks to them that their pride doesn’t starve.
pokedex_entries.violet: The mane of a male Pyroar heats up to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit during battle. Merely approaching it will cause severe burns.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators’ attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.

pokedex_data.abilities: 1. Shield Dust2. Compound EyesFriend Guard (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: When under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Any poison this Pokémon takes in is converted into a black powder and secreted. That’s why Scatterbug can eat poisonous leaves and roots.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder to repel enemies. It will eat different plants depending on where it lives.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn’t need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Until recently, people living in the mountains would ride on the backs of these Pokémon to traverse the mountain paths.
pokedex_entries.violet: As long as it has sunlight and water, Skiddo can make energy with the leaves on its body, allowing it to live on rocky mountains barren of food.

pokedex_data.local: 0030 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)0347 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0337 (Scarlet/Violet)0194 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It looks just like rotten kelp. It hides from foes while storing up power for its evolution.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It vanishes into seaweed and remains perfectly still to avoid attacks from large Pokémon. Rotten seaweed is its main food source.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It’s not good at swimming, so it clings to the seaweed. In the Alola region, it’s often found near Dhelmise.
pokedex_entries.sword: It drifts in the ocean, blending in with floating seaweed. When other Pokémon come to feast on the seaweed, Skrelp feasts on them instead.
pokedex_entries.shield: Skrelp looks like a piece of rotten seaweed, so it can blend in with seaweed drifting on the ocean and avoid being detected by enemies.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Skrelp evades its enemies by hiding amid drifting seaweed. It eats rotten seaweed to create its poison.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon is a poor swimmer. If it’s caught in a fierce storm, it will sometimes get washed far away and become unable to return to its home.

pokedex_data.local: 0020 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)0179 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)0218 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0390 (Sword/Shield)0116 (Legends: Arceus)0173 (Scarlet/Violet)0061 (The Isle of Armor)0179 (The Teal Mask)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can’t see anything.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Its four horns are a high-performance radar system. It uses them to sense sounds and smells, rather than using ears or a nose.
pokedex_entries.sun: It has trouble drawing a line between friends and food. It will calmly try to melt and eat even those it gets along well with.
pokedex_entries.moon: This Pokémon’s mucous can dissolve anything. Toothless, it sprays mucous on its prey. Once they’re nicely dissolved, it slurps them up.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It crawls along sluggishly. The swirly protrusion on its back is filled with its brain and other organs.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its entire body is covered with gooey mucus that can dissolve anything. Be sure to put gloves on if you’re going to touch it.
pokedex_entries.sword: Although this Pokémon isn’t very strong, its body is coated in a caustic slime that can melt through anything, so predators steer clear of it.
pokedex_entries.shield: The lump on its back contains its tiny brain. It thinks only of food and escaping its enemies.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: The swirly protrusion on its back is filled with all its vital organs, such as its brain and heart.
pokedex_entries.violet: When Sliggoo senses danger, the mucus coating its entire body becomes more concentrated—it’ll dissolve anything.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Its sense of smell is 100 million times better than a human’s, so even the faintest scent tells it about everything in the area. It’s like it can see with its nose!
pokedex_entries.sword: By taking in a person’s scent, it can sniff out their mental and physical condition. It’s hoped that this skill will have many medical applications.
pokedex_entries.shield: Slurpuff’s fur contains a lot of air, making it soft to the touch and lighter than it looks.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: The beaks of bird Pokémon can’t begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: If Rufflet attacks this Pokémon by pecking at it, it will retaliate with its sharp fur and poisonous black powder.
pokedex_entries.violet: Spewpa doesn’t live in a fixed location. It roams where it pleases across the fields and mountains, building up the energy it needs to evolve.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: In the past, rather than using perfume, royal ladies carried a Spritzee that would waft a fragrance they liked.
pokedex_entries.sword: A scent pouch within this Pokémon’s body allows it to create various scents. A change in its diet will alter the fragrance it produces.
pokedex_entries.shield: The scent its body gives off enraptures those who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of love for Spritzee.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Because it eats nothing but sweets, its fur is as sticky sweet as cotton candy.
pokedex_entries.sword: It eats its own weight in sugar every day. If it doesn’t get enough sugar, it becomes incredibly grumpy.
pokedex_entries.shield: The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes Swirlix’s fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out sticky string to tangle up its enemies.

pokedex_data.local: 0085 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)0131 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)0161 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0204 (Sword/Shield)0033 (Legends: Arceus)0187 (Scarlet/Violet)0082 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It sends a soothing aura from its ribbonlike feelers to calm fights.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It wraps its ribbonlike feelers around the arm of its beloved Trainer and walks with him or her.
pokedex_entries.sun: Its ribbonlike feelers give off an aura that weakens hostility in its prey, causing them to let down their guard. Then it attacks.
pokedex_entries.moon: When this Pokémon sights its prey, it swirls its ribbonlike feelers as a distraction. A moment later, it pounces.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Once a fight breaks out, it will unflinchingly charge at dragon Pokémon that are many times larger than itself.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Sylveon wraps its ribbonlike feelers around its Trainer’s arm because this touch enables it to read its Trainer’s feelings.
pokedex_entries.sword: By releasing enmity-erasing waves from its ribbonlike feelers, Sylveon stops any conflict.
pokedex_entries.shield: There’s a Galarian fairy tale that describes a beautiful Sylveon vanquishing a dreadful dragon Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: It emits a soothing aura from its ribbon-shaped organs. It wraps these appendages around quarrelers to instantly restore calm to the situation.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon uses its ribbonlike feelers to send a soothing aura into its opponents, erasing their hostility.
pokedex_entries.violet: Sylveon cuts an elegant figure as it dances lightly around, feelers fluttering, but its piercing moves aim straight for its opponents’ weak spots.

pokedex_data.local: 0016 (X/Y — Central Kalos)0160 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)0194 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0021 (Scarlet/Violet)0024 (The Isle of Armor)0089 (The Indigo Disk)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers and takes to the air.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: When attacking prey, it can reach speeds of up to 310 mph. It finishes its prey off with a colossal kick.
pokedex_entries.sun: Its favorite foods are Wingull and Pikipek. It attacks with a powerful kick and grasps them firmly in its talons.
pokedex_entries.moon: It zooms directly at its prey at flight speeds of close to 310 mph, while fiery embers scatter from gaps in its feathers.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Its tough wings don’t allow fire to pass through them. A long time ago, firefighters’ outfits were made from Talonflame wings.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Bird Pokémon make up most of its diet. It approaches at high speeds and smacks them down to the ground with its powerful kick.
pokedex_entries.sword: Talonflame mainly preys upon other bird Pokémon. To intimidate opponents, it sends embers spewing from gaps between its feathers.
pokedex_entries.shield: Talonflame dives toward prey at speeds of up to 310 mph and assaults them with powerful kicks, giving the prey no chance to escape.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: It has top-notch flying capabilities. It flies around easily, even while carrying prey that weighs more than 220 lbs.
pokedex_entries.violet: When it gets excited, it vents sparks from the gaps between its feathers. These unburnable feathers are used as a fireproof material.

pokedex_data.local: 0062 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)0197 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)0251 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0339 (Sword/Shield)0034 (The Crown Tundra)0069 (The Teal Mask)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Using its roots as a nervous system, it controls the trees in the forest. It’s kind to the Pokémon that reside in its body.
pokedex_entries.sun: This Pokémon is said to devour anyone daring to ravage the forest. To the creatures dwelling in the forest, it offers great kindness.
pokedex_entries.moon: Through its roots, it exerts control over other trees. A deadly curse falls upon anyone cutting down trees in forests where Trevenant dwell.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It’s feared as a ghost of the forest. Lumberjacks bring along Fire types, which Trevenant hates, when they enter the forest.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: This Pokémon controls trees via roots stretching from its feet, and it will attack anyone that dares to ravage the forest.
pokedex_entries.sword: People fear it due to a belief that it devours any who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the Pokémon it shares its woods with, it’s kind.
pokedex_entries.shield: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.

pokedex_data.local: 0065 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)0244 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0084 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Nothing could stop this Pokémon 100 million years ago, so it behaved like a king.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Complete restoration is impossible, allowing room for theories that its entire body was once covered in a feather-like coat.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: The king of the ancient world, it can easily crunch a car with the devastating strength of its enormous jaws.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon is from about 100,000,000 years ago. It has the presence of a king, vicious but magnificent.
pokedex_entries.shield: A single bite of Tyrantrum’s massive jaws will demolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the ancient world.

pokedex_data.local: 0064 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)0243 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)0083 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. If something happens that it doesn’t like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Its immense jaws have enough destructive force that it can chew up an automobile. It lived 100 million years ago.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Its large jaw has incredible destructive power. Some theories suggest that its restored form is different from its form of long ago.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Tyrunt is spoiled and selfish. It may just be trying to frolic, but sometimes the ones it’s trying to frolic with are gravely injured.
pokedex_entries.sword: This is an ancient Pokémon, revived in modern times. It has a violent disposition, and it’ll tear apart anything it gets between its hefty jaws.
pokedex_entries.shield: This Pokémon is selfish and likes to be pampered. It can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer just by playing around.

pokedex_data.abilities: 1. Shield Dust2. Compound EyesFriend Guard (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It’s said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: When this legendary Pokémon’s wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

pokedex_data.local: 0150 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)0205 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)0263 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)

pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: When the Kalos region’s ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It’s hypothesized that it’s monitoring those who destroy the ecosystem from deep in the cave where it lives.
pokedex_entries.sun: This is Zygarde’s form when it has gathered 50% of its cells. It wipes out all those who oppose it, showing not a shred of mercy.
pokedex_entries.moon: It’s thought to be monitoring the ecosystem. There are rumors that even greater power lies hidden within it.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: This is Zygarde’s form when about half of its pieces have been assembled. It plays the role of monitoring the ecosystem.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.
